content.question: ​The value, in millions of dollars, of transactions processed by an online payment platform is modeled by the function <math alttext="M"><semantics><mi>M</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. The value is expected to increase by <math alttext="6.1 percent sign"><semantics><mrow><mn>6.1</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> each quarter of a year. At time <math alttext="t equals 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> years, <math alttext="54"><semantics><mn>54</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> million dollars of transactions were processed. If <math alttext="t"><semantics><mi>t</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is measured in years, which of the following is an expression for <math alttext="M open parentheses t close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>M</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ? (Note: A quarter is one fourth of a year.)

choices.label: ​<math alttext="54 open parentheses 0.061 close parentheses to the power of open parentheses t divided by 4 close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><mrow><mn>54</mn><msup><mfenced><mn>0.061</mn></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="54 open parentheses 0.061 close parentheses to the power of open parentheses 4 t close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><mrow><mn>54</mn><msup><mfenced><mn>0.061</mn></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="54 open parentheses 1.061 close parentheses to the power of open parentheses t divided by 4 close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><mrow><mn>54</mn><msup><mfenced><mn>1.061</mn></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="54 open parentheses 1.061 close parentheses to the power of open parentheses 4 t close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><mrow><mn>54</mn><msup><mfenced><mn>1.061</mn></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="54 open parentheses 1.061 close parentheses to the power of open parentheses 4 t close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><mrow><mn>54</mn><msup><mfenced><mn>1.061</mn></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

topic.text: 2.5: Exponential Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
